alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:43AM EST until December 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Neponset River At Norwood affecting Suffolk and Norfolk Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Neponset River...including Norwood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Northampton. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 114.0 feet, Flooding affects the Oxbow in Northampton, including Riverside Homes on Island Road. Flooding also spreads across parts of Hadley. In Hatfield, back water from the Connecticut River will push the Mill River over its banks flooding parts of Valley Street and surrounding areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 113.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 112.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Tuesday was 113.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 114.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 112.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 114.1 feet on 04/02/1962. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early this morning at 545 AM EST.
